info.name: Protocols and IP Addresses
info.main: Let's see how well you understand how the IP protocol works.
info.results: Congratulations! Now the world will be a little safer thanks to you...

questions.q: What is the main function of an IP address in a network?

a.option: Identify and locate a device on the network.
Share files between devices.
Control data traffic on the network.
Connect devices to the internet.

questions.q: What is the difference between a public IP address and a private one?

a.option: Public IP addresses are fixed, and private ones are dynamic.
Public IP addresses are unique on the internet, while private ones can be repeated on different networks.
Public IP addresses are only used for servers, while private ones are only used for personal devices.
There is no difference between a public IP address and a private one.

questions.q: What is subnetting and why is it used?

a.option: Subnetting is a method for dividing a network into smaller subnetworks.
Subnetting is a type of internet connection.
Subnetting is only used in private networks.
Subnetting has no utility in networks.

questions.q: What advantage does DHCP offer for IP address assignment?

a.option: DHCP is more secure than manual IP address configuration..
DHCP is more efficient and easier to manage than manual configuration.
DHCP is not compatible with all devices.
DHCP can generate IP address conflicts.

questions.q: What security measures can be taken to protect IP addresses and networks?

a.option: Use a secure password for the Wi-Fi network.
Leave the Wi-Fi network open without a password.
Disable Wi-Fi network encryption.
Share the Wi-Fi network password with all neighbors.

questions.q: What is network diagnostics and why is it important to perform?

a.option: Network diagnostics is a process to identify and correct problems in a network.
Network diagnostics is a tool to measure internet speed.
Network diagnostics is only necessary for large and complex networks.
Network diagnostics is not necessary if the network is functioning correctly.

questions.q: What are the steps to perform an effective network diagnostic?

a.option: 1. Collect information about the network structure and design. 2. Analyze network traffic. 3. Evaluate network security.
1. Restart the router. 2. Check cable connections. 3. Contact the internet service provider.
1. Install antivirus on all devices. 2. Change the router password. 3. Activate the firewall.
There is no specific process for performing an effective network diagnostic.

questions.q: What tools can be used to perform a network diagnostic?

a.option: Tools integrated into Windows such as the network troubleshooter.
Third-party tools like Uptrends Uptime Monitor and Wifi Explorer.
An up-to-date antivirus.
A temporary file cleaning software.

questions.q: What are some common network problems?

a.option: Slow network.
Physical connectivity issues.
Slow DNS lookups.
All of the above.

questions.q: What is event monitoring and how can it be used to improve network security?

a.option: Event monitoring is the process of logging and analyzing activities on the network.
Event monitoring is only used to troubleshoot network performance issues.
Event monitoring is not necessary for small networks.
Event monitoring has no relation to network security.
